abstract: Peter Onufs essay in All Over the Map: The Origins of American Sectionalism measures the cost of diversity in constituencies: eventually geography tears a nation apart or supplies the preconditions for its destruction. James Madisons Federalist No. 10 argues that large republics are possible, a thesis (obliquely) opposed to Onufs. Our Constitutional Logic investigates.
title: The Geographic Center of the United States in a Well Constructed Union:  James Madisons Federalist No. 10 offers a Tendency to Break and Control the Violence of Faction,
subject: law
